alert.note: Alert for Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 8:56AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Winona, central Olmsted and southeastern Wabasha Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 855 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rochester, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elgin around 910 AM CDT. Plainview around 915 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Jarrett, Ringe, County Roads 79 And 2, Potsdam, Conception, Century High School, County Roads 18 And 4, West Albany, Chester and Bremen. People attending Rochester Area Marathons should seek safe shelter immediately! This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 219 and 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southeastern Minnesota.
